name: Olga Vitek
content: Olga Vitek Lab – Statistical methods for studies of biomolecular systems Skip to main content News Returning for 2026! May Institute on computation and statistics for mass spectrometry and proteomics is taking place on April 27 – May 9, 2026 in person on Boston campus! More>>> View all News » Contact 177 Huntington Avenue, 9th Floor Boston, MA 02115 o.vitek@northeastern.edu Our group explores synergies between statistical science and machine learning, as applied to quantitative large-scale mass spectrometry-based investigations, to understand the functioning of living organisms. Our work covers (1) statistical experimental design, (2) detecting analytes in large and complex outputs produced by spectrometers, (3) statistical selection of the relevant signals, and (4) inference of causal associations among analytes that are informative of their biological function. We develop methods and open-source software, that are broadly used in academia and industry. These include MSstats (relative quantification of proteins in mass spectrometric experiments) and Cardinal (analysis of mass spectrometric images). This also includes the infrastructure within the public repository MassIVE.quant for reproducible documentation and reanalyses of quantitative proteomic experiments. Our work is recognized with the 2019 Chan Zuckerberg Essential Open Source Software Award, and with the 2021 Gilbert S. Omenn Computational Proteomics Award of the US Human Proteome Organization.
